snippet: Not only did the borough’s total population increase, but more people moved there in the year ended July 1, 2012, than left, according to the latest estimates.
abstract: Census data show that fewer people are abandoning the Bronx; not only did the borough's total population increase, but more people moved there in the year ended July 1, 2012, than left; New York City's population over all was estimated at 8,336,697, surge of 161,564 since 2010--nearly as many as the city gained in the entire preceding decade.
lead_paragraph: Not only did the borough’s total population increase, but more people moved there in the year ended July 1, 2012, than left, according to the latest estimates.

headline.seo: More People Moving to Bronx, Census Shows
headline.main: Fewer People Are Abandoning the Bronx, Census Data Show
headline.print_headline: Fewer People Are Abandoning The Bronx, Census Data Show
